detaileddescription.para: All of the representations go in here, unless they are null.

simplesect.para: A dictionary of all of the NSBitmapImageReps that will be used for the ICO file. Keys would either be an NSNumber representation of the element used or a size from NSStringFromSize()

detaileddescription.para:
Gets an image with all of the representations of the ICOFamily instance. If no elements have been set, returns a blank NSImage.
Returns an autoreleased NSImage instance with all of the representations retrieved from elements
elements

Defines an ICOFamily and sets an image using the setImage: method
image
the image to set.

Defines an ICOFamily and sets an image using the setBitmapImageRep: method
rep
the NSBitmapImageRep to set.
- setBitmapImageRep:forElement:
+ familyWithBitmapImageRep:

Defines an ICOFamily and sets an image using the setData: method
data
the data to set.
- setData:forElement:
+ familyWithData:

Creates an ICOFamily instance and returns it autoreleased.
+ familyWithImage:
+ familyWithBitmapImageRep:
+ familyWithData:
Creates an ICOFamily instance and returns it autoreleased after setting the image.
Creates an ICOFamily instance and returns it autoreleased after setting the NSBitmapImageRep.
Creates an ICOFamily instance and returns it autoreleased after setting the data.
Sets the image for the specified kICOFamilyElement

parameterdescription.para: The image to set for the specified element.
The element to set the image as.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the @ NSBitmapImageRep for the specified kICOFamilyElement

parameterdescription.para: The rep to set for the specified element.
The element to set the image as.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the data for the specified kICOFamilyElement

parameterdescription.para: The data to set for the specified element.
The element to set the image as.

listitem.para: The size must not be NSZeroSize and the image's size and the specified size must match or this will do nothing.
The blitwise OR operator can be used to specify multiple sizes. Additionally you can use the kICOFamilyAllElements

parameterdescription.para: THe Element(s) to resize and set the image to.
The image to set to Element

Gets the raw NSData object for the ICO file If there are no representations set, this returns nil.

simplesect.para: Returns the raw data for the ICO file for use when saving.

detaileddescription.para: A class for saving an ICO file using any size under 256 pixels.
